excerpt: I'm going with a giant that is about to announce earnings in the coming week and that is Amazon ticker symbol amzn which look normally I would try to avoid choosing a stock like this that is however this time especially it really doesn't bother me at all because if Amazon shoots up on earnings that'll be great for me and the tons of other people that already own it maybe I'll look good happen this time because I actually think earnings will be pretty strong and the stock is already a buy before earnings for several reasons and even after earnings too cuz first of all you have to understand just what an already massive Behemoth of a company this is with well over half a trillion dollars in sales every year and is still somehow growing at a double digit rate it's absolutely around 5% but has been showing tremendous growth over the past five quarters with OP operating income surging by close to 400% in the last one year-over-year free cash flow has also been skyrocketing and with interest rates likely coming down next year I think their profitability will only get stronger and despite the stock trading near an alltime high right now their forward price of sales ratio of around 2.5 is actually not that bad considering the huge profit potential of course the biggest reason for that is because their cloud and digital advertising segments are both seen higher growth than the totality of their business which is still dominated by e-commerce but cloud and advertising are hugely more profitable and if they can continue growing like this which I think the upcoming earnings will give us a better idea of well then profits I think will continue to rise as well and that's why you see analysts projecting really high EPS growth above 30% on average over the next 5 years now cloud is already very large and dominant as the market leader but advertising is still relatively small on the global stage with only a single digit share meaning that there is plenty of room to keep growing there still not to mention that this quarter in particular is about to be the one that's about to be reported is the uh first one to include commercials on their Prime video platform which they launched at the start of the year and while that may not sound like a giant game changer for them at least not quite yet I do think that it's a great example of how Amazon is finding new ways of not just monetizing their business more effectively but also pushing further into advertising and I'll some Amazon stock up with this seeing some of these other companies break north of Two And even three trillion dollar market caps with Amazon still lagging behind them just doesn't feel right to me and as a long-term investor I have more than enough patience and and confidence to wait for them to join the club there too so I am a buyer right now and I will continue to be a buyer even after earnings too regardless of how it moves the stock but especially on any dips too

our medium risk option stock number two has already reported this past week and it actually fell quite a lot right after that but I think it's a solid pickup on the dip and that stock is going to be this is going to be the highest risk option of the bunch and this time I'm going with another company that actually just reported earnings this past week it fell a bit the stock is down huge from the top two and the dividend is Sky High so even though it's risky in my opinion I'm still buying more and that stock is of course Verizon ticker symbol VZ who fell on earnings by around 5% and is now still hovering around the lowest levels of the past decade down over 36% from the top but with that massive crash comes one of the biggest dividend yields it's ever paid at close to 7% however the reason why I consider to be much riskier than the rest is due to their low growth and massive amounts of debt that were greatly increased due to the investments into 5G and fiber and more and this latest quarter showed a bit of a continuation of that with lower sales than analysts were expecting as the macroeconomy struggles and consumers are choosing to hold on to their phones for longer periods of time ra rather than upgrade and because Verizon is also known for charging higher prices than Rivals like AT&T and T-Mobile well you know given the weak macroeconomy you can see why performance might be lacking for a company like that however it's not all bad news uh ryzen does usually charge a premium for good reason as their services are consistently ranked the best in the world and that strength showed in this quarter as well as profit speed estimates and subs subscriber losses actually came in lower than analysts were expecting thanks to new flexible plans and even Partnerships with streaming giants like Netflix Disney plus and HBO Max total revenue was also at least positive in terms of growth even if just barely with adjusted eida Rising a little too wireless service though uh Rose 3% probably the most important metric there which helped offset the loss in business probably due to macro conditions and their investments into FiOS and fixed Wireless continue to pay off with huge gains in subscribers on internet still cash flow from operations was down a bit but that too was also offset by a huge reduction in capital expenditures that's because they don't have to invest as heavily into 5G anymore what really concerns me though is how their dividends were barely covered in the quarter with total debt still gigantically high and that really does need to be paid off more but from all the research that I've done I gather that this was more of just like a one-off quarter that will see large improvements in the second half the same thing basically happened last year where they still ended the year with almost 8 billion dollars in excess free cash flow even after paying the dividend which they could then use to pay down debt and this year should actually be even better given the guidance of a rise in sales rise in profits and also a decrease in capex in the earnings call management also spoke a bit more on this too saying we are on track to meet our financial guidance and deliver positive phone ads this year we're back to usual levels of capex as promised and have uh struck a balance between profitable growth and free cash flow that supports both our dividend and a stronger balance sheet giving us greater flexibility to accelerate paying down debt throughout the second half of the year and closer to our long-term leverage Target our cash flow generation is solid and it shows that we are executing well against our financial objectives including supporting our dividend and paying down Deb yet with strong momentum already in the start of the second quarter I'm confident in our ability to sustain progress towards unlocking Verizon's full potential for all stakeholders and so again what I like here is the Beaten Down stock the dirt cheap valuation around 30 to 50% cheaper than the sector despite this being a market leader in both size and quality and of course a huge dividend with a manageable payout ratio below 60% and almost two decades of consecutive growth it is high risk though because again debt is gigantically high and honestly if we go into a recession uh it really wouldn't shock me all that much to see a cut in the dividend especially if it's a big recession but at these levels as a long-term investor I'm kind of okay with the risk that I'm taking here I know what I'm betting on and it still feels worth it to me personally
